title: When someone's raging at me in Spanish

replies.body: *Curses back in Dutch*
_Throws a German swear in for good measure_

Honestly, anything in german works.

SCHLAPPERLAPCHEN!
SAUERKRAUT!
FLUGZEUG!
SCHMETTERLING!
PANZERKAMPFWAGEN!
Is it weird that I find German absolutely hilarious when pronounced despite it sounding incredibly angry?

DU WAGST ES MEINE SPRACHE HERUNTER ZU MACHEN DU AMERIKANISCHER SCHWEINEHUND!
ICH WERDE DIR ZEIGEN WIE WIR IM DEUTSCHEN REICH MIT SOLCHEN FREVELN UMGEHEN!

No it's not.

Simply saying German words like the ones I mentioned above are an easy way to make people laugh.
Especially with the way I pronounce them :^)
I feel ya bro
At least in German you get cool phrases like "Was ist das?".
That's one angry butterfly.
Don't even need to go that far. Anything consisting entirely of consonants will do. People know what head -> keyboard looks like.

Cusses in Korean but sees everything become boxes.
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}

"Leck mich im Arsch" (literally "Lick me in the arse") is a canon in B-flat major composed by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, K. 231 (K. 382c), with lyrics in German. It was one of a set of at least six canons probably written in Vienna in 1782.[1] Sung by six voices as a three-part round, it is thought to be a party piece for his friends.
*Rage's in Scottish* (it's like raging in english, but with an accent .__. )

Pogue mahone.
*(Gaelic for "Kiss my arse.")*
Wait, how do you know whether they're raging at you or debating the rising price of milk? You don't speak Spanish right?
If I'm playing League I'm gonna assume any words in a foreign language are swear words

No hablo espanol. Muy comprendo espanol.

The instant you can pick out a few clearly Spanish words is usually enough indication.
http://i601.photobucket.com/albums/tt92/rmsutherland/1239904971884.gif
Implying I can't pick out Spanish curse words after looking them up.
You LITERALLY just said if you pick out ANY Spanish words you immediately think they're raging.

Incorrect, although I will give you it could be inferred.

I just meant if you knew a few Spanish words, you can usually tell if they're speaking Spanish. Whether or not they're raging at you is determined by whether or not you know the curses they are using to insult you with.
If they've modified anything by putting pinche in front of it, they are raging.

1st off, it's a latin language and English is 50% latin, so you kinda are required to understand. Unfortunately, hispanophones often misspell to the point of the words being unrecognisable, and English is a misspell in its entirety.
Secondly, once you learn a couple insults and see them associated to the name of your champ, that's it.
http://i2.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/newsfeed/001/041/121/476.gif

"Bleh bleh bleh" 

(I'm a bubble blowing diaper baby.... Or Count Dracula...)
http://orig09.deviantart.net/07b1/f/2015/270/4/6/tumblr_nq3m7yt2ok1r7oljbo4_250_by_polkadotdonnie-d9b5cjq.gif
tfw you speak in Spanish back since they expect you not to know Spanish LUL
no hablos taco amigo

"AJAJAJAJAJAJAJAJAJAJAJAJAJAJAJAJAJAJAJAJAJAJAJ XD"
-Jax 0/17/1  30 cs @45 min with exhaust/heal only 2 items BT and gunblade

hue
google translate is your friend :^)

I usually reply with "you ate a whole wheel of cheese and you pooped in the refrigerator?" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yRxCJE3Fyq8
When someone starts raging at me in Spanish, I get all hungry. They say some delicious things.
I want that cat. How much RP?
I'm not for sale
huehuehue mordekaiser es numero uno 1v3 any gank u mad?
I just type in all caps "AY NO, NO NUNCO PIDO ATÚN!" I forgot what it meant since my 7th grade Spanish class, but it usually gets the job done.
I reply, "iADIOS, PUTA!", then resume split pushing HAM.
It should probably be "no pido nunca atún," which would basically mean, "I never ask for tuna." ;P
I find it hilarious to simply write stars (***** ). Everyone automatically assumes I'm flaming them.
they probably have chat filter on
I was coming here for a tali wall joke/pun ;c was disappointed. +1 anyways.
